id: 445
text: Figure 2. (a) Number of new infections for each of the viruses, shown as 7-day means from January 1 2020 to December 31 2021. (b) Cumulative asymptomatic and symptomatic infections for all viruses. (c) Fraction of population vaccinated with at least one dose and with both doses. (d) Cumulative deaths from each of the viruses. cause. Small variations in these four parameters (5%) result in changes in the number of infections and deaths that are an order of magnitude larger; see Fig. 4. COVID-19 mortality rate Î¼W I affects the number of infected individuals who are alive and can participate in the spread of the disease.
